 The Federal government reacted because they saw it as a challenge to their power. It was a clash of which type of system would prevail; a Federation or a Confederation.
 whether;
 A Federation with a strong national government that could over-ride state's rights in the cause of the 'national' interest.
 or
 A Confederation in which the states are the stronger party, with the national government merely there to regulate relations between the states, so that no one state dominates over any other.
 
 South Carolina had left the British Empire of its own free will, and probably was not willing to see another 'empire' subvert its power. It had joined a coalition, because by itself, it would have been retaken by Britain quite easily.
